info.official_title: To Explore the Efficacy of Hypofractionated Radiotherapy Followed by AG Regimen Chemotherapy Plus Camrelizumab Immunotherapy as Neoadjuvant Therapy for Borderline Resectable/Locally Advanced Pancreatic Cancer

inclusion_lines.line: 1. Age:18 to 75 years old, male or female;

criterions.exact_snippets: Age:18 to 75 years old
male or female

inclusion_lines.line: 2. Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) performance status of 0-1;

criterions.exact_snippets: Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) performance status of 0-1

inclusion_lines.line: 3. Tumor was located in the pancreas;

criterions.exact_snippets: Tumor was located in the pancreas

inclusion_lines.line: 4. Pathological diagnosis was pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma or acinar cell carcinoma;

criterions.exact_snippets: Pathological diagnosis was pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma
Pathological diagnosis was ... acinar cell carcinoma
No distant metastasis

inclusion_lines.line: 6. The pancreatic tumor is located more than 1cm away from the duodenum；

criterions.exact_snippets: The pancreatic tumor is located more than 1cm away from the duodenum

inclusion_lines.line: 7. Clinical assessment was locally advanced or critical for resectable.

criterions.exact_snippets: Clinical assessment was locally advanced
Clinical assessment was ... critical for resectable

inclusion_lines.line: Locally advanced pancreatic cancer diagnostic criteria: (1) due to tumor invasion, venous occlusion or involving a wide range of superior mesenteric vein branch of jejunum, cannot safely - superior mesenteric vein reconstruction. ② (pancreatic head/uncinate process tumors) tumor contact with superior mesenteric artery or celiac artery > 180°. Tumor contact with superior mesenteric artery or coeliac trunk artery > 180°, tumor contact with coeliac trunk artery and invasion of abdominal aorta.

criterions.exact_snippets: tumor invasion, venous occlusion or involving a wide range of superior mesenteric vein branch of jejunum
tumor invasion, venous occlusion or involving a wide range of superior mesenteric vein branch of jejunum
tumor invasion, venous occlusion or involving a wide range of superior mesenteric vein branch of jejunum
criterions.criterion: involvement of superior mesenteric vein branch of jejunum

criterions.exact_snippets: cannot safely - superior mesenteric vein reconstruction
(pancreatic head/uncinate process tumors) tumor contact with superior mesenteric artery or celiac artery > 180°
criterions.criterion: tumor contact with superior mesenteric artery

criterions.exact_snippets: (pancreatic head/uncinate process tumors) tumor contact with superior mesenteric artery or celiac artery > 180°
Tumor contact with superior mesenteric artery or coeliac trunk artery > 180°
criterions.criterion: tumor contact with coeliac trunk artery

criterions.exact_snippets: tumor contact with coeliac trunk artery and invasion of abdominal aorta

inclusion_lines.line: Critical for resectable pancreatic cancer diagnostic criteria: (1) contact with portal vein tumor - superior mesenteric vein > 180 °, 180 ° or less or contact combined intravenous contour irregular or venous thrombosis, but safety is complete resection and reconstruction; The tumor contacted the inferior vena cava. ② (pancreatic head/uncinate process tumors) the tumors contacting the common hepatic artery, but not involving the celiac artery or the origin of the left and right hepatic arteries, can be completely resected and safely reconstructed; Superior mesenteric artery tumor contact 180 ° or less; The tumor contacts the aberrant arteries (such as accessory right hepatic artery, alternative right hepatic artery, alternative common hepatic artery, etc.). (pancreatic body and tail tumors) tumor contact with superior mesenteric artery ≤180°; Tumor contact with celiac artery ≤180°; 7.There was no history of immune system diseases, other malignant tumors, myocarditis, coronary heart disease, other cardiovascular and cerebrovascular diseases, thyroid dysfunction, liver and kidney diseases, psychiatric diseases, infectious diseases, or systemic diseases other than those mentioned above.

criterions.exact_snippets: contact with portal vein tumor - superior mesenteric vein > 180 °, 180 ° or less or contact combined intravenous contour irregular or venous thrombosis
The tumor contacted the inferior vena cava
(pancreatic head/uncinate process tumors) the tumors contacting the common hepatic artery, but not involving the celiac artery or the origin of the left and right hepatic arteries

requirements.expected_value: origin of the left and right hepatic arteries

criterions.exact_snippets: Superior mesenteric artery tumor contact 180 ° or less
The tumor contacts the aberrant arteries (such as accessory right hepatic artery, alternative right hepatic artery, alternative common hepatic artery, etc.)
(pancreatic body and tail tumors) tumor contact with superior mesenteric artery ≤180°
criterions.criterion: superior mesenteric artery tumor contact (pancreatic body and tail tumors)

criterions.exact_snippets: Tumor contact with celiac artery ≤180°

no history of immune system diseases, other malignant tumors, myocarditis, coronary heart disease, other cardiovascular and cerebrovascular diseases, thyroid dysfunction, liver and kidney diseases, psychiatric diseases, infectious diseases, or systemic diseases other than those mentioned above

inclusion_lines.line: Participants were willing to join in this study, good adherence and written informed consent.

criterions.exact_snippets: Participants were willing to join in this study
good adherence
written informed consent
Healthy volunteers allowed

criterions.exact_snippets: minimum age of 18 Years

exclusion_lines.line: 1. Patients who did not meet these inclusion criteria;

criterions.exact_snippets: did not meet these inclusion criteria

exclusion_lines.line: 2. Poor cognitive ability, inability to answer questions, inability to fill out questionnaires, or mental disorders;

inability to answer questions
inability to fill out questionnaires
